text: Robert "King" Moody (December 6, 1929 - February 7, 2001) was an American actor. He was best known for playing Ronald McDonald in McDonald's commercials from 1969 until his retirement from the role in 1985. ==Early life== Moody was born Robert Moody in New York City, New York on December 6, 1929. ==Career== ===Ronald McDonald character=== From the 1970s to the 1980s, he played Ronald McDonald for the McDonald's commercials. After his retirement in 1985, he was replaced by Squire Fridell. ==Death== On February 7, 2001, Moody died at the age of 71. ==Other websites== * ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Comedians from New York City Category:American television actors Category:Actors from New York City
title: King Moody
